filesToIgnore.description:
An array of file globs to never report warnings for.

The globs follow [minimatch] syntax, and any file that matches any
of the listed globs will never show any linter warnings. This will
typically not have a performance benefit, as the file will usually
still need to be analyzed.

[minimatch]: https://github.com/isaacs/minimatch

ignoreWarnings.description:
Deprecated way of spelling the `warningsToIgnore` lint option.

Used only if `warningsToIgnore` is not specified.

rules.description:
The lint rules to run. Can be the code of a collection of rules like
"polymer-2" or an individual rule like "dom-module-invalid-attrs".

warningsToIgnore.description:
Warnings to ignore. After the rules are run, any warning that matches
one of these codes is ignored, project-wide.

addPushManifest.description:
If `true`, generate an [HTTP/2 Push
Manifest](https://github.com/GoogleChrome/http2-push-manifest) for your
application.

addServiceWorker.description:
Generate a service worker for your application to cache all files and
assets on the client.

Polymer CLI will generate a service worker for your build using the
[sw-precache library](https://github.com/GoogleChrome/sw-precache). To
customize your service worker, create a sw-precache-config.js file in your
project directory that exports your configuration. See the [sw-precache
README](https://github.com/GoogleChrome/sw-precache) for a list of all
supported options.

Note that the sw-precache library uses a cache-first strategy for maximum
speed and makes some other assumptions about how your service worker should
behave. Read the "Considerations" section of the sw-precache README to make
sure that this is suitable for your application.

basePath.description:
Update the entrypoint's `<base>` tag, to support serving this build from a
non-root path, such as when doing differential serving based on user
agent. Requires that a `<base>` tag already exists. This works well in
conjunction with the convention of using relative URLs for static
resources and absolute URLs for application routes.

If `true`, use the build `name`. If a `string`, use that value.
Leading/trailing slashes are optional.

browserCapabilities.description:
Capabilities required for a browser to consume this build. Values include
`es2015` and `push`. See canonical list at:
https://github.com/Polymer/prpl-server-node/blob/master/src/capabilities.ts

This field is purely a hint to servers reading this configuration, and
does not affect the build process. A server supporting differential
serving (e.g. prpl-server) can use this field to help decide which build
to serve to a given user agent.

excludes.description: URLs of files and/or folders that should not be inlined.

inlineCss.description: Inline external CSS file contents into <style> tags.

inlineScripts.description: Inline external Javascript file contents into <script> tags.

rewriteUrlsInTemplates.description: Rewrite element attributes inside of templates when inlining html.

sourcemaps.description: Create identity source maps for inline scripts.

stripComments.description:
Remove all comments except those tagged '@license', or starting with
`<!--!` or `<!--#`, when true.

bundle.description:
By default, fragments are unbundled. This is optimal for HTTP/2-compatible
servers and clients.

If the --bundle flag is supplied, all fragments are bundled together to
reduce the number of file requests. This is optimal for sending to clients
or serving from servers that are not HTTP/2 compatible.

exclude.description: CSS files listed here will not be minified.
HTML files listed here will not be minified.

minify.description: Minify HTMl by removing comments and whitespace.

insertPrefetchLinks.description:
Insert prefetch link elements into your fragments so that all dependencies
are prefetched immediately. Add dependency prefetching by inserting `<link
rel="prefetch">` tags into entrypoint and `<link rel="import">` tags into
fragments and shell for all dependencies.

Note this option may trigger duplicate requests. See
https://github.com/Polymer/polymer-build/issues/239 for details.

exclude.description: JavaScript files listed here will not be compiled.

compile.description: Use babel to compile all ES6 JS down to ES5 for older browsers.

exclude.description: JavaScript files listed here will not be minified.

transformModulesToAmd.description: Transform ES modules to AMD modules.

name.description: The name of this build, used to determine the output directory name.

preset.description:
A build preset for this build. A build can inherit some base configuration
from a named preset.

swPrecacheConfig.description:
A config file that's passed to the [sw-precache
library](https://github.com/GoogleChrome/sw-precache). See [its
README](https://github.com/GoogleChrome/sw-precache) for details of the
format of this file.

Ignored if `addServiceWorker` is not `true`.

Defaults to `"sw-precache-config.js`.

autoBasePath.description: Set `basePath: true` on all builds. See that option for more details.

componentDir.description: The directory containing this project's dependencies.

entrypoint.description:
The path relative to `root` of the entrypoint file that will be served for
app-shell style projects. Usually this is index.html.

extraDependencies.description:
List of file paths, relative to the project directory, that should be
included as extraDependencies in the build target.

fragments.description:
The path relative to `root` of the lazily loaded fragments. Usually the
pages of an app or other bundles of on-demand resources.

moduleResolution.description:
Algorithm to use for resolving module specifiers in import and export
statements when rewriting them to be web-compatible. Valid values are:

"none": Disable module specifier rewriting. This is the default.
"node": Use Node.js resolution to find modules.

npm.description:
Sets other options' defaults to NPM-appropriate values:

   - 'componentDir': 'node_modules/'

root.description:
Path to the root of the project on the filesystem. This can be an absolute
path, or a path relative to the current working directory. Defaults to the
current working directory of the process.

shell.description: The path relative to `root` of the app shell element.

sources.description:
List of glob patterns, relative to root, of this project's sources to read
from the file system.
